title: Understanding the Problem
text: When you toss a coin, you have $$2$$ possible outcomes: heads (H) or tails (T). When you roll a 6-sided die, you have $$6$$ possible outcomes (the numbers $$1$$ through 6). The two actions are independent, meaning the outcome of the coin toss doesn't affect the outcome of the die roll.

title: Multiplication Principle
text: Since the coin toss and the die roll are independent events, the total number of outcomes is found by multiplying the number of outcomes for the coin by the number of outcomes for the die. This is an application of the Multiplication Principle.

title: Application
text: Since the coin has $$2$$ outcomes and the die has $$6$$ outcomes, multiply the number of outcomes.
